channel.title: Color/Tolerance Matcher! - Get exact tolerance needed to find a certain color!
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt][b]Color/Tolerance Matcher! - Get exact tolerance needed to find a certain color![/b][/size] by Ron[/center] I made this small program to get the right colors I needed to make scripts for a different game, and it worked very well! Program is attached. Instructions are in the script, and they say to fill out the const. :P Here is an example I got when I tried to match 3 colors (16114904,16579057,16711163) with the color 16777215.
/----- Matching colors with 16777215 -----\ 16114904 matched at tol: 49 16579057 matched at tol: 16 16711163 matched at tol: 5 Thanks for using the ColorToleranceMatcher by Ron Successfully executed
So with this information I could make a function more efficient by looking for the exact tolerance needed to find the color range I'm looking for. [scar] program New; var x, y, x2, y2 : Integer; begin GetClientDimensions(x2, y2); // Here I'm looking for a color, with a tolerance of 49, so I can find all // the numbers within the same tolerance up to the color: 16114904 if(FindColorTolerance(x, y, 16777215, 0, 0, x2, y2, 49))then begin WriteLn('Color found at coords ('+IntToStr(x)+', '+IntToStr(y)+')'); end; end. [/scar] I hope I helped a little. :D ~Ron

item.title: Color/Tolerance Matcher! - Get exact tolerance needed to find a certain color!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[center][size=15pt]Color/Tolerance Matcher! - Get exact tolerance needed to find a certain color![/size]
by Ron[/center]

I made this small program to get the right colors I needed to make scripts for a different game, and it worked very well! Program is attached. Instructions are in the script, and they say to fill out the const.

Here is an example I got when I tried to match 3 colors (16114904,16579057,16711163) with the color 16777215.

/----- Matching colors with 16777215 -----\ 16114904 matched at tol: 49 16579057 matched at tol: 16 16711163 matched at tol: 5

Thanks for using the ColorToleranceMatcher by Ron
Successfully executed

So with this information I could make a function more efficient by looking for the exact tolerance needed to find the color range I’m looking for.

[scar]
program New;

var
x, y, x2, y2 : Integer;

begin
GetClientDimensions(x2, y2);
// Here I’m looking for a color, with a tolerance of 49, so I can find all
// the numbers within the same tolerance up to the color: 16114904
if(FindColorTolerance(x, y, 16777215, 0, 0, x2, y2, 49))then
begin
WriteLn(‘Color found at coords (’+IntToStr(x)+’, ‘+IntToStr(y)+’)’);
end;
end.
[/scar]

I hope I helped a little.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: Color/Tolerance Matcher! - Get exact tolerance needed to find a certain color!
